name: Chole Bhature
history: Chole Bhature is a beloved North Indian dish, particularly from Punjab, known for its combination of spicy chickpeas (Chole) and deep-fried bread (Bhature).
description: Chole Bhature is a delightful pairing of spicy chickpeas curry and fluffy, deep-fried leavened bread. It's a popular breakfast and street food dish.

equipment.name: deep frying pan
equipment.description: A pan used for deep frying foods.

equipment.name: pressure cooker
equipment.description: A cooking device used to cook foods quickly under steam pressure.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: A bowl used for mixing ingredients.

equipment.name: rolling pin
equipment.description: A tool used for shaping and flattening dough.

instructions.title: Prepare Chole
instructions.description: Soak chickpeas overnight. Cook them in a pressure cooker with salt and water until soft. In a separate pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, onions, and ginger-garlic paste. Cook until onions are golden. Add tomatoes, chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the oil separates. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer.

instructions.title: Prepare Bhature Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Add water gradually to form a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for a few hours.

instructions.title: Roll and Fry Bhature
instructions.description: Divide the dough into balls. Roll each ball into an oval shape. Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Deep fry each bhatura until puffed up and golden brown on both sides.

tips: The dough for bhature should be soft and pliable.
Adding a pinch of sugar to the chole masala enhances the flavor.
Serve hot with sliced onions, lemon wedges, and green chutney.
variations: Add paneer to the chole for a different twist.
Use whole wheat flour for a healthier bhature.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh, but chole can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat chole on the stovetop or in a microwave. Bhature are best when fresh.
presentationTips: Garnish chole with coriander leaves and serve with a side of pickles.
